DOCNAME: CASE OF GRZEGORZ HULEWICZ v. POLAND (No. 2)
CONCLUSION: No violation of Article 5 - Right to liberty and security
JUDGES: David Thór Björgvinsson;Giovanni Bonello;Lech Garlicki;Ledi Bianku;Mihai Poalelungi;Nicolas Bratza
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in Lębork . He is currently serving a prison term .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was arrested on suspicion of forgery of documents as well as armed robbery and drug trafficking , committed in an organised criminal group . Since DATE he had been in hiding .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG ( Sąd Rejonowy ) remanded him in custody , relying on the reasonable suspicion that he had committed the offences in question . It also considered that detaining the applicant was necessary to secure the proper conduct of the proceedings , because the applicant had threatened the victim at the time of the commitment of the alleged offence . The court also stressed the severity of the anticipated sentence and the fact that the applicant had a previous criminal record .

CARDINAL . An appeal by the applicant against the detention order was unsuccessful . On DATE the ORG ( PERSON ) upheld the challenged decision , basically repeating the arguments of ORG and relying additionally on the fact that in DATE the applicant had gone into hiding .
CARDINAL . NORP The argument that the applicant had gone into hiding was repeated by ORG in its decisions of DATE and DATE , extending the applicant 's detention .
CARDINAL . Numerous appeals by the applicant against decisions extending his detention and all his subsequent applications for release were unsuccessful .

CARDINAL . Subsequently , the applicant 's pre - trial detention was prolonged on several occasions ( on DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE and DATE and on DATE , DATE and CARDINAL DATE ) . In all their detention decisions the courts repeatedly relied on a strong suspicion that the applicant had committed the offences in question , which was supported by evidence from witnesses . They attached importance to the grave nature of those offences and the likelihood of a severe sentence of imprisonment being imposed on the applicant .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG lodged a bill of indictment with ORG . The bill of indictment comprised CARDINAL charges of , among others , participation in an organised criminal group , drug trafficking , uttering threats and robberies brought against CARDINAL defendants . The applicant was charged with participation in an organised criminal group , drug smuggling , uttering threats and forgery of documents .

CARDINAL . Once the length of the applicant 's detention had reached the statutory DATE maximum laid down in LAW of LAW ( Kodeks Postępowania Karnego ) , the first - instance court no longer had jurisdiction to extend it . Consequently , it was ORG ( Sąd Apelacyjny ) which issued further extensions . In its first extension decision , on DATE , ORG relied on the reasonable suspicion that the applicant had committed the offences with which he had been charged and on the considerable complexity of the case . The court also held that the risk that the applicant and other co - accused would obstruct the investigation had been established .

CARDINAL . The applicant 's detention was subsequently extended by ORG on DATE , CARDINAL DATE and DATE . The ORG relied on the reasonable suspicion that the applicant had committed the offences in question and on their serious nature . It also stressed that the fact that the applicant and the co - defendants were charged with participation in an organised criminal group created the reasonable fear that they might obstruct the proceedings or try to influence witnesses . The ORG additionally examined the conduct of the proceedings and found no undue or unjustified delays . DATE and DATE ORG held CARDINAL hearings . CARDINAL . On DATE ORG convicted the applicant as charged and sentenced him to DATE imprisonment .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court lifted the applicant 's detention .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant and his lawyer lodged appeals against the first - instance judgment .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG heard the appeals , partly varied the first - instance judgment , acquitted the applicant of CARDINAL charge of forgery and sentenced the applicant to DATE and DATE imprisonment .
CARDINAL . The applicant lodged a cassation appeal ( kasacja ) with ORG ( Sąd Najwyższy ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the cassation appeal as manifestly ill - founded .
